oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Optimal control during feedback failure
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: CHAKRABORTY, D
HAMMER, J
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: systems
optimal control
robust control
bang-bang control
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The problem of controlling a perturbed open loop system so as to keep its performance errors within bounds is considered. The objective is to maximise the time during which performance errors remain below a prescribed ceiling, while the controlled system's parameters are within a specified neighbourhood of their nominal values. It is shown that there is an optimal open loop controller that achieves this objective. Conditions under which the optimal controller generates a bang-bang control input signal are characterised. In general, it is shown that the performance of the optimal controller can always be approximated by a bang-bang signal.
